cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 2nd ranked rain rate was recorded today with a peak rate of 16.6mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  5.69mm of rain fell during the storm's 3.2 hours length.  A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.
A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 4th for length since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 10 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 64.9 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 1105 m), feels like temperature (up 2.8°C), and outside temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 382.6m higher than yesterday, 10.4m lower than the past week, 1104.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 565m to 1838m and averaged 1493.1m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Rain showers likely, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. Weather could become unsettled.
